text: William Booth (10 April 1829 – 20 August 1912) was an English Methodist preacher. He and his wife Catherine, founded the Salvation Army. He became its first "General" (1878–1912). He was named among the 100 Greatest Britons in 2002 by the BBC. Category:1829 births Category:1912 deaths Category:Christian religious leaders Category:English people Category:Methodists
title: William Booth
